pullRequest.title: [JENKINS-63002] Revamp tabs and bigtables
pullRequest.bodyText:
See JENKINS-63002.
This PR revamps the tables and tab styles according to the design briefs provided on the Jira ticket. The scope of this PR is limited to tables implementing the .bigtable class.
NOTE: the design was done with the assumption that we want to keep the tables and tabs together as was decided on #1344

Screenshots




Notable changes

The tables and tabs have updated colors that are consistent with the new Jenkins color palette. They are consistent with sidebar and footer. They also have improved in-cell spacing.
The components are fully themeable.
Tables are no longer supposed to be wrapped in a .pane-frame class. This generated some inconsistencies. Tables inside a .pane-frame will not look bad, but should gradually be migrated. Only a few plugins are affected.
Tables and tabs CSS code is refactored into LESS modules.
The tabBar.jelly widget now admits a showBaseline parameter that will render the underline when set to "true".

Follow up work
There should be follow-up PR's to iron out the .pane-frame appearance, especially on the plugins management Advanced page. It's also pending to update plugins by remove the .pane-frame wrapper.
Proposed changelog entries

Entry 1: JENKINS-63002, Revamped the tabs and tables with better spacing and a consistent color palette.


Proposed upgrade guidelines
N/A
Submitter checklist

 (If applicable) Jira issue is well described
 Changelog entries and upgrade guidelines are appropriate for the audience affected by the change (users or developer, depending on the change). Examples

Fill-in the Proposed changelog entries section only if there are breaking changes or other changes which may require extra steps from users during the upgrade


 Appropriate autotests or explanation to why this change has no tests
 For dependency updates: links to external changelogs and, if possible, full diffs


Desired reviewers
@timja
@uhafner
@daniel-beck
@oleg-nenashev

Maintainer checklist
Before the changes are marked as ready-for-merge:

 There are at least 2 approvals for the pull request and no outstanding requests for change
 Conversations in the pull request are over OR it is explicit that a reviewer does not block the change
 Changelog entries in the PR title and/or Proposed changelog entries are correct
 Proper changelog labels are set so that the changelog can be generated automatically
 If the change needs additional upgrade steps from users, upgrade-guide-needed label is set and there is a Proposed upgrade guidelines section in the PR title. (example)
 If it would make sense to backport the change to LTS, a Jira issue must exist, be a Bug or Improvement, and be labeled as lts-candidate to be considered (see query).

commit.message: Extracts tab, panes, tables styles to a module
Unwraps view and plugin tables from .pane-frame

Update table styles

- Styles are applied to the .bigtable class. There are some changes to .pane-frame
- Some styles are inherited from .pane-frame

Fix widget styles conflicting with tables

- Differentiates the side-panel widget pane borders from .pane-frame elements
- Fix padding spaces on project view header. The Functions#nbspIndent function was changed to return 2 less spaces
- Restored missing border on filtered plugins management table
- Fixed the alignment of some tables

Restyles the tab baseline and new item button

- The tabBar.jelly now has a prop to show a baseline. The default display of the baseline can also be themed

nodes.bodyText: have you decided which one should be used?

commit.message:
Address review comments

- Have two options for header color in sortable table headers (bigtables or not)
- Remove bigtable header font size variable as it was not changing anything
- Remove outdated comment

Revert "Unwraps view and plugin tables from .pane-frame" to solve merge conflicts

This reverts commit cfd90c48332a5205471dbe7b53eb37f42772c3fd.
